{"step_by_step_thinking": "Waldeyer's lymphatic chain, also known as Waldeyer's ring, is a ring of lymphoid tissue in the throat. It includes the palatine tonsils (A), the pharyngeal tonsils (B), and the tubal and lingual tonsils (C). However, the post auricular nodes (D) are not part of this chain. They are located behind the ears and are part of the lymphatic system, but not specifically part of Waldeyer's lymphatic chain.", "answer_choice": "D"}
